Articles.Content:
Today I got this mission offered.

Looks like a grand challenge

If you take a unmanned Probe and land on Eve last, this will be no real big challenge.

(with ISRU this is like no challenge at all)
Sounds like a pretty cool mission!
I don't even have the contract, and I want to do that mission!

I went for totally overengineered.

Just after take-off from the Mun, on the way to Minmus. Where it'll gas up as well.
Holy shiz. That is one hell of a mission! I got the Duna 4 Challenge where I need to flyby the Mun, Minmus, Duna, and get back to Kerbin. Not as wellpaying as this, nor as difficult. Still, very fun!
Careful with the gas up.  If the wrong vessel docks in the wrong order you'll lose the "with the same vessel" portion of the contract.
Thanks for the heads up. This beast has it's own on board refinery. It's currently at Minmus converting cheese into rocket fuel.

Looks like a lot of fun to plan and design for. You get this mission with a "do NOT use ISRU" clause if you play on Scott Manly Hard Mode. Either way would be a fun read through with lots of pics.

Edited December 21, 2015 by Shamus6200

Hmmmm, I was thinking ISRU setups were expensive... but now I see they aren't so bad. 1x 2.5m converter and 2x large drills barely cost more than a single KS-25 engine (although that is a really expensive engine for its size). Still it could be nice if you seperate just a small probe with a heat shield and chutes, and lob it at eve at the end, and keep the rest of your craft with the ISRU at gilly to serve as a fueling base (have the probe that goes to eve be the root part to be safe?)

Otherwise, the entire craft is basically a complete loss once it goes suborbital at Eve. (yes, I know the contract payout will be high enough to cover the loss, but in my save I like to set up as much infrastructure and waste as little money as possible).
I agree with you, the craft is a write off. It's a fun little expedition though
But including the fact your budget for this is around 2m dollars it's doable.

In my mind, I think of every 1000 kerbal dollars as a million USD. So a craft that cost 10,000 kerbals dollars in game is $10 million. I know it's low, but I'm old, so a million dollars still seems like a lot of money :-)
